alert.note: Alert for Uvalde (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued October 26 at 3:01PM CDT until October 27 at 5:12AM CDT by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Austin/San Antonio TX has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Texas... Nueces River At Laguna affecting Uvalde County. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Nueces River at Laguna. * WHEN...Until late tonight. * IMPACTS...At 10.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding reaches low water crossings on Highway 55 above Barksdale on Hackberry Creek. The Nueces River crossing at Barksdale is very dangerous. East of Camp Wood Farm to Market 337 crosses Camp Wood Creek in three places. Vehicular related drownings have occurred at all these sites. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 2:45 PM CDT Thursday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage to 10.1 feet late this afternoon. It will then fall below flood stage to 7.1 feet late this evening before continuing a gradual fall through Friday. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Fld Observed Forecasts (3 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Nueces River Laguna 10.0 7.1 Thu 2 pm CDT 1.4 0.9 0.9 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued late tonight at 315 AM CDT.
